Hi,

Of strange note is that I'm getting different behavior when using
JUnit's textual user interface versus its graphical user
interface.  

The following snipit executes just fine with the text UI:

    QueryExecutorHome
        ejbHome =
            (QueryExecutorHome)PortableRemoteObject.
                narrow( obj, QueryExecutorHome.class);

But by simply changing from:

java junit.textui.TestRunner TestQueryExecutorEJB
 
to:
 
java junit.swingui.TestRunner TestQueryExecutorEJB
 
The swingui version fails with the java.lang.ClassCastException.

Any ideas?

thanks,
Mike
